definition: to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4

definition: to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
